alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Jackson; Lewis; Mason; Pleasants; Ritchie; Roane; Tyler; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:07AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Meigs, Washington, east central Gallia, southeastern Athens, northern Calhoun, Wirt, northwestern Roane, northern Jackson, Wood, western Harrison, Pleasants, Ritchie, northwestern Mason, Doddridge, northern Gilmer, northwestern Lewis and Tyler Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 406 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Marietta to near Gallipolis. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, Belpre, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Harrisville, St. Marys, Pomeroy, Glenville, Elizabeth, Middlebourne, Racine, Grantsville, Coolville, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Ravenswood, Williamstown, Paden City and Salem. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 140 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 14. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Jackson; Lewis; Mason; Pleasants; Ritchie; Roane; Tyler; Wirt; Wood
